intro: Angelica acutiloba subsp. iwatensis, commonly known as the Iwate angelica, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, compound leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streambanks. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species in its native range.
